comments.comment:
Jean,
which article did you request the quotation for?

Got it now:
instead of the new sap item number (8 digits), the elfa number (7 digits) should be transmitted.

Done.

I have changed the email-quoteProductPriceBody.vm file to use the codeErpRelevant for SAP :

Article Number: #if(${ctx.movex})${ctx.product.name}#else${ctx.product.codeErpRelevant}#end <br/>

I have also create the new folder for the release v2.0.m7 and add information for the post installation.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3991] Delivery Address: Phone Number fields -> 3 or 1 field needed, mandatory or not?
item.description:
At the moment, a delivery address offers 3 phone number fields, at least one of which needs to be filled (screenshot).

The specification defines that there should be 1 phone number field, not mandatory.

Questions

  • Why is the impl different from the spec, has this changed based on a business requirement?
  • How should this be handled going forward? The recommendation from a usability point of view is to have only 1 field, optional, in all shops. SAP expects one field. Movex may or may not need a phone number on the delivery address.

-> Business decision needed
item.summary: Delivery Address: Phone Number fields -> 3 or 1 field needed, mandatory or not?

comments.comment:
We only need one contact phone number on the additional delivery address.
The field is NOT mandatory.
Raphael, please change as discussed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3915] LT: Add/Edit address not working (MyAccount and Checkout)
item.description:
https://test.a.distrelec.lt

  • Log in as nando.mueller+lt1@gmail.com / distrelec
  • to to my account / addresses

there, either

  • edit the billing address and save, or
  • add a new shipping address and save.

Result:

  • Global error message "(lt)Please correct the errors below." appears
  • No form fields are highlighted as wrong/missing (and all mandatory fields are filled)
  • I cannot see an actual input error, see print screen
  • Validation wrong on FE side or on SAP side?
item.summary: LT: Add/Edit address not working (MyAccount and Checkout)

comments.comment: Note: applies both to address change in my account an checkout.

it seems that the phoneNumber is not transmitted from the frontend in the addressForm data.

In the controller AccountPageController the bindingResult contains the following error:

org.springframework.validation.BeanPropertyBindingResult: 1 errors
Field error in object 'b2BShippingAddressForm' on field 'phoneNumber': rejected value [null]; codes [AtLeastOneNotBlank.b2BShippingAddressForm.phoneNumber,AtLeastOneNotBlank.phoneNumber,AtLeastOneNotBlank.java.lang.String,AtLeastOneNotBlank]; arguments [org.springframework.context.support.DefaultMessageSourceResolvable: codes [b2BShippingAddressForm.phoneNumber,phoneNumber]; arguments []; default message [phoneNumber],[Ljava.lang.String;@48f0fbdc]; default message [Įveskite bent vieną telefono / mobiliojo telefono / fakso numerį]

Could you please check the frontend?
Login that works: distrelec.testing+lt1@gmail.com / distrelec

It is definitely not a frontend error, since there is no frontend validation around telefone numbers. Somehow, the mapping of the path variable of the phone field seams not to be working correctly, since no field related errors are generated.

The Phone number is correctly sent to the backend when trying to create the address. see print screen.

Regards Jan

The forms are completely wrong. The following logic should be implemented: (Confirmed by Florian)

  • The billing address has 3 attributes for phone numbers
    + Phone number
    + Mobile number
    + Fax number

One of theses numbers is mandatory

  • The shipping address has 1 attribute for phone numbers
    + Contact phone

This phone number is NOT mandatory

Please be sure that the same patterns are used in MyAccount and Checkout!

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3914] Mobile Rollout
item.description:
Proposed procedure for new / upcoming country roll-outs:

Configuration
Sevenval provides three environments instead of two for each country:

  1. Test environment ("M-Test")
  2. Livepreview environment ("M-Livepreview") (requires new domain: livepreview.m.distrelec.XY)
  3. Live environment ("M-Live")

Sevenval introduces an additional HTTP User Agent "Sevenval FIT Preview" for communications between FIT Server and Desktop Systems:

Behaviour

  • M-Test and M-Live environments send User Agent "Sevenval FIT"
  • M-Livepreview sends User Agent "Sevenval FIT Preview"

Before launch:

  • M-LivePreview is protected by HTTP Auth.
  • M-Live is not protected by HTTP Auth.
  • The access to D-Live is only allowed for user agent "Sevenval FIT Preview".
  • All other user agents are redirected to maintenance page (for all countries, also those that were live already before).
    So also M-Live for all countries is redirected to maintenance page.

Live Rollout:

  • Distrelec removes redirect to maintenance page for all user agents (and IPs)

Test environment:

– |Auth| --> M-Test ---- UA:"Sevenval FIT" ---> D-Test
– |Auth| -------------------------------------> D-Test

Live environment:
Before / during launch:

– |Auth| --> M-LivePreview — UA:"Sevenval FIT Preview" ---> D-Live
------------> M-Live ---------- UA:"Sevenval FIT" -----------> D-Maintenance
------------------------------- UA:* ------------------------> D-Maintenance

After launch:

– |Auth| --> M-LivePreview — UA:"Sevenval FIT Preview" ---> D-Live
------------> M-Live ---------- UA:"Sevenval FIT" -----------> D-Live
------------------------------- UA:* ------------------------> D-Live

Advantages:

  • Also mobile shops of countries that were live before are redirected to the maintenance page while rollout process
  • Only one party (Distrelec) is involved in Live Switch and has full control
    the environment M-LivePreview can be deactivated any time after launch.

Disadvantages:
Hybris Configuration for Payment Return URLs needs to be able to maintain two sets of return URLs for the live Environment, dependant to the User-Agent String (with or without Preview) livepreview environment will not provide valid ssl certificates.

comments.comment:
Hoi Rene,
Siehst du das als gangbaren weg? ist es möglich mit den verschiedenen return-urls von EVOpayment umzugehen?
Gruss, Rafael

Ciao Rafael

Klar, das können wir machen:

Aufwand:

  • Anpassung neue URL: ca. 3h
  • Anpassung Apache config für Maint.-Page: 2h
  • Testing: 2h

Wenn ich das richtig sehe, werden wir das nur für Live machen,
dass heisst wüe können diese neue Implementierung und Konfiguration auf dem Live nicht testen.

live.m.distrelec verweist auf die gleiche Instanz wie m.distrelec D.h. der Test wäre dann auf der Liveumgebung.
Es wird ein anderer UserAgent übergeben und wir können somit die Maintenance-Seite und den Livegang selber steuern.
Etwas ist mir heute in den Sinn gekommen, wie sieht es aus mit dem einbinden von DIBS und deren Back-URL's. LT wird ja mit DIBS als payment-provider anstatt EVOpayment aufgesetzt. Ist dies ein Problem?

> DIBS und deren Back-URL's.
Ja das ist ein bisschen ein Problem:

  • Bei DIBS sind die URLs in ihrem System konfiguriert
  • Ich denke wir müssen pro System (TEST, PRE-LIVE, LIVE) eine Seite bei DIBS anlegen
Hallo Rene, bitte wie besprochen umsetzen, wir haben die Freigabe von Florian.

done

  • implementierung von DIBS und EVO
  • Apache config
  • DIBS Template angepasst

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3779] FactFinder Export - Add Availability based on Warehouse
item.description:
Current Situation
Today FactFinder receives the availability information: Available or not (global over all warehouses) through true/false.

Very short Business Case
What we need to do to be able to handle backlog and deliveries is to downgrade results based on warehouse. For the CH site, products available in the CH site come first, then come DE, then come SE.

Change Request
The FactFinder Export needs to export in addition to the global availability, three new fields:

  • Availability for CH (true/false)
  • Availability for SE (true/false)
  • Availability for DE (true/false)
item.summary: FactFinder Export - Add Availability based on Warehouse

comments.comment:
Are there only those 3 warehouses in all salesOrgs? And how would external warehouses (Streckenartikel) have to be handled?

But either way, we would suggest a slightly different approach:

  • Export the availability information not per specific warehouse, but per
    • Primary warehouse of the salesOrg
    • Secondary warehouses of the salesOrg
  • This information is already available
  • This approach is more generic and future proof and will work for all sites likewhise.
  • This specifically also concerns FactFinder, where the config can be done more simply and generically

=> David, would you agree to this slightly changed approach?

David agrees.
Please use only the information as true or false.

Dear all,

The Change is being implemented in FF however to simplify the Setup (lower maintenance effort and keep a good perfomance we need to re-modify the export):

Current Situation

  • InStock (Values: 1 or 0)
  • InDefaultStock (Values: 1 or 0)
  • InAlternativeStock (Values: 1 or 0)

New Situation

  • InStock (Values: 0, 1, 2)
    o 0 = Product not on stock
    o 1 = Product available on alternative stock
    o 2 = Product available on default stock
    o Note that if a product is on default stock, alternative stock option should not be checked (2 would win

Described Change

  • InStock field to be modified as described in the “New Situation” section
  • InDefaultStock field to be removed
  • InAlternativeStock field to be removed

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3218] Additional Event-Tracking of Clicks on Teaser-Tracking Elements
item.description:
For all Webtrekk Teaser-Tracking implementations (compare WT-Spec chapter 9) the following functional amendment (Event-Tracking – compare WT-Spec chapter 8.2 p. 18/19) is required regarding click-event on any teaser-elements:

"onclick=wt.sendinfo(

{linkId:'[[Teaser-Tracking ID]]',sendOnUnload:1}

);"

Thereby two Webtrekk-requests are fired when a user is clicking on any teaser-element.

Briefly pre-discussed the above requirements with Dominic Modalek via phone (12.2.14).

Thanks! Mark
item.summary: Additional Event-Tracking of Clicks on Teaser-Tracking Elements

comments.comment:
Estimate 3 Days Frontend Work. No Backend Work needed.

This change affects many different components and therefore needs some time to implement and test.
Reconsider after go-live of 1.1

Mark, I assign it to you until this will be reconsidered again.

Info: only track onClick, not on shifting to the left or right in a carousel.

Hi Florian

To be foreseen for v1.3 if possible.

Thx Mark
Could you please check with Dominic what it needs do be done?

Dominic,
can you do a rough effort estimation for planning?

I estimate 3 - 4 days for this change.

Mainly because there are so many different modules involved that must be changed and tested. See Chapter 8 https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/Webtrekk+-+Frontend+Implementation for an Overview.

Florian,
please evaluate the priority of this task (in the context of FE bugs, FF improvements and ELFA development)

Please allocate and assign accordingly.

Thx Mark

Implemented. See 9.3 Click on Teaser Items - Always activated:

https://wiki.namics.com/display/distrelint/Webtrekk+-+Frontend+Implementation

Tested every occurence with a HTTP Sniffer and all IDs seem to be transmitted correctly. Only the "Feedback Campaign" Product Teaser could not be tested locally, so please don't forget to test it on the Q System.

@ Dominic -> Fix Version?

Thx Mark
